intro: Cacalia fagifolia, commonly known as the woodbine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its stems are often hairy and can climb or trail along the ground. Cacalia fagifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
